MotiFit is a simple application where you can track your daily physical activities and receive reminders to move more during your working hours and after that.
The information collected will be anonymous. You will not be identified by name in any publications resulting from this study.
For questions about the study or any technical issues, please contact:\nTasnim Ismail,\n+974 6632 1282

string-array.name: health_tips
string-array.item: Take the stairs instead of the elevator.
It is advised to do low to moderate exercise (walking or cycling) 3 times a week.
A healthy adult requires 15 to 30 minutes/day of basic physical activities
Creating a balance between technology use and physical activity is an important habit in your daily life
Routine physical activity should be done with the aim of accumulating a minimum of 30 minutes daily each day in the week or in most days of the week.
When you exercise in hot weather, check urine color and quantity, to know how much water you have lost.
When you exercise in hot weather, consume enough salt, potassium and other electrolytes to balance sweat loss.
Drink at least two liters per day in normal conditions, and drink up to six liters per day in hot conditions, of water or isotonic sports drinks
When you sit position yourself correctly in the seat and make sure you sit straight and that your buttocks and back are square and completely squeezed into the seat.
You don\'t have to exercise for hours if your schedule is busy, a little exercise is better than none
Preparing meals and snacks to bring to the office is healthier and cheaper
Sleepiness is often cause by dehydration, so stay hyderated.
Thirst is often mistaken for hunger, so stay hyderated.
Leave a bottle of water on your desk. And don\'t forget to drink
You can add lemon or lime in your water for added flavor and no guilt
Proper sleep is an essential ingredient to a healthy lifestyle
Breathing relieves stress, remember to take deep breaths
Drink green tea after walking to help losing weight
Drinking water can promote weight loss
Replace your unhealthy snacks with nuts. They\'re incredibly nutritious, healthy and deliicious
Take a walk in the morning in the outdoors to help your body producing vitamin D
If you are feeling depressed or sad, take a walk and get some fresh air to feel better
Walk every day to give your memory power a serious boost
Look for walking communities to encourage each other and build social support
To stay motivated to walk, try walking for a social cause
To stay motivated to walk, explore different paths every day
Go for a stroll with your friends or family in the evening or after dinner
To stay motivated to walk, walk your dog in the morning or evening
If you are new to walking, walk for short intervals then gradually increase the duration
Park farther away from your office than usual and walk to and from your car
When you feel stressed or exhausted, take a short break and walk the stress away
